programme.title: Jazz @ Lakers
programme.sub-title: Utah Jazz at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: The Lakers' postseason situation becomes clear after hosting the Jazz. Los Angeles halted a three-game slide against Utah with a 135-133 overtime win April 4. Lakers star LeBron James delivered the final two of his 37 points for the deciding basket.

programme.title: Wild @ Blackhawks
programme.desc: The Wild seek a second consecutive season-series sweep of the Blackhawks. Minnesota has won eight straight versus Chicago, with former Hawks goaltender Marc-Andre Fleury earning two of those victories. Minnesota is 20-13-6 on the road this season.

programme.title: Player 54: Chasing the XFL Dream
programme.desc: With a coaching staff that includes two Steelers greats, Hines Ward and Joey Porter, the Brahmas try to rally against the Roughnecks. Iconic Rams receiver Ricky Proehl coaches his son Austin as professional football returns to St. Louis.

programme.title: Player 54: Chasing the XFL Dream
programme.desc: Coach Wade Phillips and the Houston Roughnecks bring back a familiar face to offset recent injuries. Tensions rise for coach Terrell Buckley and the winless Orlando Guardians, who host the Seattle Sea Dragons, a team looking to extend its win streak.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.sub-title: Weather Guard Truck Race on Dirt
programme.desc: The NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series goes to Bristol for the Weather Guard Truck Race on Dirt. The April 1 race at Texas saw Carson Hocevar get his first Trucks win and Hailie Deegan finish sixth after Nick Sanchez and Zane Smith's last-lap wreck.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Cup Series rolls on with the Food City Dirt Race. Joey Logano won the Cup Series' first race on a dirt track in 51 years here in 2021. The series returned to the dirt track in 2022, when it became a night race and was won by Kyle Busch.
